channel.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server Team
channel.description:
The team behind this server is:
[b]Moparisthebest[/b] - the big boss dog of this website, owns and runs it, approved this server and is willing to maintain the back-end from his side, will be the main person with access to the dedicated server that our server runs on.
[b]Administrators:[/b]
xEnt - myself, administrated RSCAngel, BeyondRSC, TheLastStand & even RSCEmulation for a short while. KO9 - (so far waiting on him to see if he wants this position)
[b]Moderators[/b]
newty - a moparscape hero, moderates all boards and mainly deals with RS2 stuff, however he's a great lad and a trusted member at moparscape, hes willing to help out on this server which he will be doing. Rodgerwilco (old rsc player)- A veteran member of the RSC community, also has had previous experience with moderation and administration of multiple servers. A good friend of mine and he has proved himself to be trust worthy and a great person for this position Lothy - administrator of moparscape, australian, nothing more to say, he may not be as active as other mods, however hes still someone that can be trusted and even helping a little is fine.
[b]Developers[/b]
xEnt - myself, i have a full time job and i plan on playing this server a lot, so i won't be anywhere near as active in development as i was back at RSCAngel. i will help out though, i will be recruiting a LOT of casual developers though, even if they do little bits here and there, it all adds up, and all code gets ran by me so nothing can go wrong.
object/ephemeral/Protosstribe - this guy is a true RSC hero, made countless servers from scratch most famously known from Geminus and Moonspell, very smart lad and a good friend, he will helpout when he can.
[b]MORE TO COME.[/b]
[b]List of people that i'd like to join the team, reply if your interested[/b]
vortex - dev meatstick - dev yong ming - dev necroth - mod/graphics dev dexto - mod peeter - dev codeforfame - dev vrunk - dev
note: devs won't have moderator powers. in fact they will have no powers.

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server Team
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

The client could use fixing and touching up. Jagex isn’t perfect. Doesn’t necessarily mean that you’re going to be adding custom GUI or anything like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server Team
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:55, topic:392659"]Just asking, why client isn’t open source? You can easily check serverside protection and make your bot client act the same way as normal client. So it can’t be the reason why it isn’t open source.
And

And you should restrict access to all packetbuilders serverside if you have somekind of protection against it.[/quote]

Looking at the client (obfuscated or not) is enough to detect all anti-bot systems. Does it send any additional data etc, if so it’s not hard to guess how it will be analyzed server side. However client’s source should not be available. Some people still live in the year 2003 and create deob/extension bots, if they don’t have the source new client releases will be quite annoying for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server Team
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Just asking, why client isn’t open source? You can easily check serverside protection and make your bot client act the same way as normal client. So it can’t be the reason why it isn’t open source.
And

And you should restrict access to all packetbuilders serverside if you have somekind of protection against it.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server Team
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:52, topic:392659”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=489832.msg3591702#msg3591702 date=1304700111]
If the client is not open source, if a update somebody does requires things programmed into client, how would it happen? Should the clientside code be sent to main developers to be checked and added?
[/quote]

If we are keeping it original RSC, then the client should never need any updates.[/quote]
I wasn’t talking about features, I was talking about fixes and client in overall improvement, nothing related to features aren’t and never shouldn’t be touched on RSC replica.

Read full topic
